news_header: A €10 million donation from Peter Sarlin's foundation will create new AI-focused professorships at 13 Finnish universities, excluding Lappeenranta. The initiative supports the establishment of the Elis Institute, a European AI research network.
news_text: Peter Sarlin, founder of Silo AI, has donated €10 million to create AI-focused professorships at 13 Finnish universities, excluding Lappeenranta. This funding will support the Elis Institute, a research network that consolidates European AI research. The Ministry of Education and Culture will contribute €40 million over three years to the institute. The initiative aims to attract top researchers to Finland, leveraging the country's favorable environment for talent and advanced computing resources like the Lumia supercomputer. Research will encompass both technical and social aspects of AI, with various universities focusing on different applications, including legal implications and business models.
